basics.name: Mohammed Abdalazeem
basics.label: PhD Student in Transportation Engineering
basics.summary: PhD student in Transportation Engineering at UMass Amherst with expertise in data science applications for transit systems, origin-destination modeling, and transportation safety analysis.

work.name: University of Massachusetts Amherst
work.summary: Conducting research on origin-destination modeling, passenger typology analysis, and transportation safety using machine learning and data science techniques.
highlights: Developed novel trip chaining models with 70% reduction in MAE
Created spatiotemporal passenger typology framework using DTW clustering
Published 4 peer-reviewed papers in transportation journals

work.name: University of Massachusetts Amherst
work.summary: Teaching assistant for graduate and undergraduate courses in transportation systems and probability & statistics.
highlights: CE-ENGIN 260: Probability and Statistics for Civil and Environmental Engineers

work.name: University of Khartoum
work.summary: Provided tutorials for undergraduate civil engineering courses and conducted research on elevated light rail systems.
highlights: Received Best Project Award for Khartoum Skytrains Network research
Taught Environmental Engineering, Transportation Engineering, and Structural courses

volunteer.summary: Mentored undergraduate students in data analysis, transportation modeling, and computational techniques.
highlights: Guided students from Howard University and RPI
Supervised projects on transportation systems and mobility analysis

awards.title: UMass Amherst Civil and Environmental Engineering Departmental Fellowship
awards.summary: Departmental fellowship awarded for academic excellence and research potential.

awards.title: Best Project Award
awards.awarder: University of Khartoum Civil Engineering Department
awards.summary: Awarded for innovative research on Khartoum Skytrains Network: Implementing an Elevated Light Rail System.

awards.title: First Class Honors
awards.summary: Graduated with First Class Honors (equivalent to Summa Cum Laude) with CGPA 7.39/10.

publications.name: Origin-destination inference in public transportation systems: A comprehensive review
publications.publisher: International Journal of Transportation Science and Technology
publications.summary: Comprehensive review of state-of-the-art methods for origin-destination estimation in transit networks, identifying key advancements, data sources, and modeling techniques.

publications.name: Extracting spatiotemporal bus passenger trip typologies from noisy mobile ticketing boarding data
publications.summary: Novel clustering framework using hierarchical clustering and dynamic time warping to identify distinct spatiotemporal passenger typologies in bus systems.

publications.name: Enhanced seasonal typology-informed transit trip chaining via mobile boarding and survey data
publications.summary: Trip chaining model incorporating passenger typology and seasonal variations with gradient boosting for spatial error correction.

publications.name: Khartoum sky trains network: A study on implementing caterpillar trains concept in Khartoum
publications.summary: Feasibility study for implementing a caterpillar-style elevated light rail system to alleviate traffic congestion in developing cities.

references.name: Professor Jimi Oke
references.reference: PhD Advisor and Research Supervisor specializing in transportation systems engineering and data science applications in transportation.

projects.name: Origin-Destination-Transfer (ODX) Model
projects.summary: Advanced model integrating trip chaining, passenger typology, and spatial error correction to infer complete trip patterns including transfers in regional transit systems.

projects.name: Crash Typology Analysis
projects.summary: Machine learning framework using UMAP and Gaussian Mixture Modeling to classify census tracts into distinct crash typologies based on historical patterns.
